lead_paragraph: An article in some editions on Friday about the status of the Yankees after a 14-3 loss to the Toronto Blue Jays attributed an erroneous distinction to the Seattle Mariners, against whom the middling Yankees have a perfect record this season. Seattle was the second-worst team in baseball at the time — not the worst, a claim belonging to Washington. (The Mariners were 46-81, and the Nationals were 45-83 after Thursday’s games.).
